Use: Geometric calculations and estimations involving individual and gross floor area

Description: Height of the building. Often comprised of two measurements - eave height and ridge height
Use: Used to construct 3D volumes and surfaces from 2D data

Description: 3D volumetric model of the building comprised of surfaces. Varying levels of detail
Use: Provides geometric information about the outer shape of the building

Description: Evenly spaced elevation values referenced to a projection or coordinate system
Use: Determines the horizon line and location of shading objects for radiation calculations

Description: Descriptive information about the relationship with other buildings
Use: Determines the boundary conditions for simulation by identifying shared and exposed walls
Comment (Resolution, Quality,..): Survey data for energy certification of residential buildings

Description: Detailed information on the construction and materials used in the elements of the building envelope
Use: The thermophysical properties of the building elements are used in the simulation to calculate heat flows
Comment (Resolution, Quality,..): Survey data for energy certification of residential buildings

Description: Age of the building or time since the last retrofit
Use: Infer typical building materials based on regulations at the time of construction/refurbishment
Source: Federal Register of Buildings and Housing (GWR) – Gebaude
Comment (Resolution, Quality,..): Buildings records are listed by their unique identification EGID. 13 Age catergories between 1919 and 2015. 10 of which are after 1960.

Use: Used to determine internal schedules, temperature and humidity set points required for simulation
Source: Federal Register of Buildings and Housing (GWR) – Gebaude
Comment (Resolution, Quality,..): Residential buildings are categorised as Single Family Home, Multi Family Home, Residential Building with Side Usage and Building with partially residential usage.

Provides information on the structure of the Swiss Economy. Provides information on the number of people working, full time and total. Contains the coordinates of the building location and the business sector assosciated with the building

Description: Detailed information about the number, type, age-group of the inhabitants of the building
Use: Used to determine load schedules specific to an occupant type
Source: Federal Register of Buildings and Housing (GWR) – Wohnung
Comment (Resolution, Quality,..): This data can be linked to the Gebaude (Building) data through the EGID identified. The dataset contains a household composition variable.

Description: Provides information on whether the house is owner occupied, rented or is a social housing
Use: Used to infer information about construction, refurbishment status or sceduling

Description: Existence and parameters of energy systems (Renewables, HVAC, Lighting and DHW) in the building.
Use: Used in calculations to determine the effciency of the energy system and resulting demand profiles
Comment (Resolution, Quality,..): Survey data for energy certification of residential buildings

Source: Federal Register of Buildings and Housing (GWR) – Gebaude
Comment (Resolution, Quality,..): Information is provided on the heating system, with 7 categories including space heating. The presence of hotwater is also recorded, but there are no details on the system. The energy carrier/fuel for heating is also specified.

Description: The street address of a building
Use: Can be used for aggregation, clustering and linking. Address data could also be used to infer information about the age or use of a building.
Comment (Resolution, Quality,..): Register of Buildings and Dwellings can be downloaded as a .csv for each canton individually. It contains records for each building in the canton, providing the unique EGID number and the address. Easting and Northing coords are provided using CH1903+/LV95 projection

Description: Parameterised buildings models representing a specific category
Use: Used to populate the parameters of missing or questionable data records
Comment (Resolution, Quality,..): A shape file which contains the urban typology of the buildings contained withing. e.g. Large Urban, Secondary Urban Centers, Rural, Tourist etc.

Description: Rates for a new building construction, building demolition and/or building refurbishment.
Use: The stock development data acts as independet parameter that 'drives' a possible stock development forecast.

Description: The availability and description of district heating or external energy resources (e.g. CHP) as well as grid accessibility.
Use: Used to evaluate the reliance and influence of the building on external energy systems

Description: Environmental variables experienced by the building over the simulated period
Use: Directly used in the simulation to determine boundary conditions and heat flows
Comment (Resolution, Quality,..): Contains weather files in formats specifically for building energy simulation.
